column3: Have you ever thought about where chocolate comes from? It comes from trees.

column2: Trees to Pods to Beans to Chocolate - National Council of Teachers of Mathematics
column3: Making chocolate involves growing cacao trees, harvesting the pods, and fermenting the beans. After that process, the beans are roasted and ground into chocolate. Cacao farmers must calculate the size of the cacao tree farm, the age of each cacao tree, and the number of pods produced by the trees to ensure that enough beans are produced each year.

column2: Trees to Pods to Beans to Chocolate - National Council of Teachers of Mathematics
column3: Roberto and his family own a 7-acre farm in Belize that contains 2,360 cacao trees. Each tree bears fruit 3 to 5 years after planting and continues producing fruit for about 30 years, producing an average of 30 pods per year. Each pod contains about 40 cacao beans, and approximately 500 cacao beans will produce 1 pound of chocolate.
